result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Niya Lanier

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request to Appear by Zoom - Granted
Defendant's Request to Appear by Zoom
Scheduling conference on September 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:45 AM - cases called - 21CF325, 21CF326, 21CF327, 21CF328, 21CF346, 21CF368, 22CF15, 22CF40 and 22CF65.  Attorney Cana G Kohn appeared by video for Niya Lanier.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - victim rights scheduling conference; no victim wishes to be heard.  Statement by the Court - off the record scheduling with Judicial Assistant.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:36 am Prosecuting attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Niya Lanier not in court.  Attorney Cana G Kohn appeared by video for Niya Lanier. . Case called appearances given.  No victims are appearing today.  JA will contact the parties to set the next court appearance.
Status conference on April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:24 PM - case called.  Defendant Niya Lanier appeared by video, in custody from the Copper Lake School.  Attorney Cana G Kohn for Niya Lanier appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Sgt. Investigator Kevin Orzech duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Polzin.  Defendant identified by Sgt. Investigator Orzech.  Cross by Atty Kohn.  Redirect by Atty Polzin.  Argument by Atty Kohn.  Rebuttal by Atty Polzin.  Statement by the Court.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Bond will continue.
Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No violent or abusive contact with the victim while the Defendant is placed in the juvenile detection facility.  Upon release no contact with the victim.
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
No violent or abusive contact with the victim while the Defendant is placed in the juvenile detection facility.  Upon release no contact with the victim.

1:32 PM - cases called - 21CF368, 22CF15 and 22CF65.  Defendant Niya Lanier appeared by video, in custody from Copper Lake Schools.  Attorney John Zich appeared on behalf of Attorney Cana G Kohn in court for Niya Lanier.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of these matters.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Information filed in 21CF368.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts no guilty plea in 21CF368.  Statement by Atty Zich regarding complaints in 22CF15 and 22CF65 - waive readings.  Argument by State as to bond in 22CF15 and 22CF65.  Court sets bond.  Discussions regarding scheduling.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
